summary: Spider-Man: Far From Home on Track for a Giant-Sized Opening Weekend
title: Spider-Man: Far From Home on Track for a Giant-Sized Opening Weekend
excerpt: Spider-Man: Far From Home is poised to have a major domestic box office haul across Independence Day weekend.
description:
A little over two months after his resurrection in Avengers: Endgame, Spider-Man will swing back into theaters for Spider-Man: Far From Home. With a July 2 release, the upcoming Marvel Cinematic Universe film is on track for a huge holiday opening weekend.

Early estimates from industry analysts forecast Far From Home earning $154 million domestically across its first six days in theaters. The increased window is due to Sony opening the film on Tuesday, July 2, giving it a two-day lead on Independence Day and the subsequent weekend.

RELATED: Spider-Man Wears Multiple Masks In New Far From Home IMAX Poster

The box office predictions are a considerable increase over 2017’s Spider-Man: Homecoming, which opened to $117 million before earning $334 million in North America and $880 million worldwide, second only to Spider-Man 3 as the highest-earning Spider-Man solo film to date. The 2007 film earned a staggering $890.9 million worldwide.

With a reported production budget of $180 million, not including marketing or distribution, Far From Home looks like another solid success for Sony and Marvel Studios. The film picks up shortly after the events of Endgame, with Peter Parker joining his classmates on a summer school trip across Europe, only to encounter Mysterio, Nick Fury and otherworldly destructive beings known as Elementals.

RELATED: Holland, Hemsworth Interview Each Other For MiB, Spider-Man: Far From Home

Opening July 2, director Jon Watts’ Spider-Man: Far From Home stars Tom Holland, Samuel L. Jackson, Zendaya, Cobie Smulders, Jon Favreau, JB Smoove, Jacob Batalon and Martin Starr, with Marisa Tomei and Jake Gyllenhaal.

summary: So LizardWatch is over (for now) And guys, seriously.  We deal with this years ago! The Lizard was destroyed, Curt has been in...
body:
So LizardWatch is over (for now)

And guys, seriously.

We deal with this years ago! The Lizard was destroyed, Curt has been in full control for ages! If you wanna bring the Lizard consciousness back, you need to resurrect it! You can’t just be like: “without the chip Curt can go feral any moment uhhhh!!” No, no, no. It’s not like that, he was fine without any aids, something traumatic has to happen to bring the Lizard back, just like something traumatic had to happen to bring Curt back when he was presumed subsumed by the Lizard.

This is bullshit

summary:
Hey so I’ve noticed we don’t see Marvel characters cry a lot. There are soft cries like this one
And then obviously our Queen™️...
body:
Hey so I’ve noticed we don’t see Marvel characters cry a lot. There are soft cries like this one

And then obviously our Queen™️ has been through hell so we see her heavy crying (though it’s always in the moment).

And then in Infinity War and Endgame we got an onslaught of tears from our favs to emphasize how broken they all were:


Which like totally broke me but my point is that we never really see crying removed from the painful moment. Like, Peter in Far From Home has swollen eyes and a tired face and it’s not even in the same movie as the cause of it.

(Credit to @ironspiderpeter )

He’s still crying.

We don’t know when in FFH takes place. It’s either in the very beginning, or it’s around the climax. Regardless, Peter joined the select few Marvel characters to heavy, sobbing-style cry on screen in Homecoming (stuck under the building) which was meant to emphasize his innocenence and youth.

This is something very, very different. This is the loss of his third father figure. The only person we’ve seen cry this hard is Wanda, who has also lost 3 immediate family members and a loved one. (They never gave Tony the chance to cry like that on screen)

Two most broken characters? Yup. Given the justice of crying on screen? Thankfully.

blog.name: marvelheroperil

blog.description: This is a backup blog to the sideblog MarvelPeril in case it gets deactivated. This blog dedicates to Marvel superheroes falling into perilous situations such as getting captured, hurt or whatever. Note that there WON'T be any pictures of superheroes from live-action Marvel movies/TV Shows.

summary: In this AU where there’s no sliding timescale, the middle-aged Spider-Man managed to stop a thrown car but he ends up getting...
caption:
In this AU where there’s no sliding timescale, the middle-aged Spider-Man managed to stop a thrown car but he ends up getting captured by Old Man Otto for an experiment. Peter Parker wakes up in a lab to find that he’s not only strapped down, Ben Reilly and Harry Osborn are there. 

- Spider-Man: Life Story #4, 2019
